meanings.definition: The act of making something rugged or rough.
meanings.sent1: The ruggedizations of the path made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: The ruggedizations of the terrain required sturdy boots.
meanings.sent3: The ruggedizations of the old bridge gave it a tough character.
meanings.sent4: His ruggedizations of the wooden table gave it a weathered look.
meanings.sent5: The ruggedizations of the fabric made it suitable for outdoor use.

meanings.definition: The process of toughening or strengthening something.
meanings.sent1: The ruggedizations of the metal increased its durability.
meanings.sent2: The ruggedizations of the muscles came from hard work.
meanings.sent3: The ruggedizations of the armor made the knight feel invincible.
meanings.sent4: Her ruggedizations of her resolve helped her face any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The ruggedizations of the rope made it reliable for climbing.

meanings.definition: The state of being made more durable or resilient.
meanings.sent1: The ruggedizations of the material made it last for years.
meanings.sent2: The ruggedizations of the structure ensured it could withstand harsh conditions.
meanings.sent3: The ruggedizations of the tree made it stand strong against the wind.
meanings.sent4: The ruggedizations of his spirit helped him overcome adversity.
meanings.sent5: The ruggedizations of the technology improved its performance in extreme environments.
